text:
Peace agreement in Colombia to boost tourism growth to two digits Published on : Tuesday, September 15, 2015
If talks between Colombia Government and FARC-EP reaches an agreement, tourism will benefit the most in the economic sector, said President of Colombia Juan Manuel Santos.
Santos said that when the peace agreement is reached with the Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia-People’s Army (FARC-EP), tourism will grow two digits in this country, and also that the visit of foreign tourists grew by 13 percent.
Santos made this statement when opening the 21st General Assembly of the World Tourism Organization (WTO), running until next Thursday in the city of Medellin, the second largest city in Colombia.
He said that the country’s potential for tourism can be fully developed in peacetime and that peace would be built also from tourism and for tourism.
During the opening ceremony of the event Secretary General of WTO Taleb Rifai said the world moved to Medellin to offer two messages, of trust and support to the Colombian people.
“Imagine the potential of this country when we can sign the peace agreement and consolidate it from the dialogues taking place in Cuba”, Santos told delegates from 156 countries.
